org.pac4j.http.client.indirect

Class IndirectBasicAuthClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pac4j.core.util.InitializableWebObject
      • org.pac4j.core.client.BaseClient<C,U>
        • org.pac4j.core.client.IndirectClient<C,HttpProfile>
          • org.pac4j.http.client.indirect.IndirectHttpClient<UsernamePasswordCredentials>
            • org.pac4j.http.client.indirect.IndirectBasicAuthClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Client<UsernamePasswordCredentials,HttpProfile>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicAuthClient

    public class IndirectBasicAuthClient
extends IndirectHttpClient<UsernamePasswordCredentials>

    This class is the client to authenticate users through HTTP basic auth. It was previously named: BasicAuthClient.

    For authentication, the user is redirected to the callback url. If the user is not authenticated by basic auth, a specific exception : RequiresHttpAction is returned which must be handled by the application to force authentication.

    It returns a HttpProfile.

    Since:
    1.8.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu
    See Also:
    HttpProfile
